content.description: The crux is low, but the upper part keeps you on your toes with some run-outs on loose rock.  Still a great route though!
content.protection: More bolts than you can see and 1 piton to a threaded anchor, with some scary slings.  You can bring long runners to thread some huecos up high if you want to and a small cam can protect between the second and third bolt, just bring a long sling for it.
content.location: This is the left most route on the wall with the close first 2 bolts.

content.description: There are 3 or 4 routes on this heucoed wall, which is just off the dirt road.  From the car, you strain your neck as you look up this featured cliff and see anchors and a few slings tied off in hollow heucos.  The 3 routes listed in Eric's Desert Rock III are  (left to right) Vivarium (5.11b), Adrenaline (5.10d), and Earl Grey (5.10b/c).  Jim Beyer soloed these routes in January of 1997.
content.protection: Some cams in heucos, bolts here and there and slings to tie off hollow heucos.
content.location: Right off the road , on the left, 2.9 miles up Kane Springs Canyon.  (1.1 miles past Kane Springs)
